New Records: Roston Chase played an ice-cool 42 off 27 deliveries to cap off his stunning first innings catch and rescue West Indies' topsy-turvy run-chase.
Key Match Events: West Indies won by 5 wickets against Papua New Guinea
Roston Chase and Andre Russell got the job done
Kabua Morea hurls it full and on middle, Andre Russell gets his bat out in front of the pads and flicks it towards wide long on for a run
Roston Chase squeezes it out with an open bat face in front of short third for a quick single
Roston Chase opens up his front hip and with a still head, goes inside out over cover for four more runs
Roston Chase gets down on one knee and swats it aerially but in the vacant deep backward square leg region for a boundary
Roston Chase reaches out and carves it to the left of deep point for a couple of runs
Roston Chase thumps it flat towards long on and picks up a boundary
Roston Chase swings through the line and pumps it over long off for a biggie
Roston Chase clips through mid-wicket for a run
Andre Russell drives it to the left of long off for a couple of runs
Andre Russell plays it with a straight bat down to long off for a single
Pre-Game Insights: Co-hosts West Indies get off to a winning start. Regarded by many as dark horses for the tournament, the West Indies are aiming for a record third T20 World Cup title.
Post-Match Reflections: Rovman Powell, the victorious skipper of West Indies is up for a chat. He starts by appreciating PNG for the way they played. Mentions that it was important to start well and he is happy to get the two points. Feels that they gave away 10-15 runs too many and wants to improve on that aspect.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Papua New Guinea, on the other hand, should be extremely pleased with their bowling effort as they pushed the Windies to their limits. Alei Nao was brilliant with the new ball and bowled a wicket-maiden first and should have had Nicholas Pooran as well.
Others: West Indies vs Papua New Guinea, Match 2, ICC Men's T20 World Cup, 2024, Jun 02, 2024
West Indies beat Papua New Guinea by 5 wickets
